snippet: Mitt Romney used Solyndra’s headquarters to emphasize the Obama administration’s failings, while an Obama aide took his message to Mr. Romney’s former workplace in Massachusetts.
abstract: Mitt Romney delivers a campaign speech at the headquarters of failed solar company Solyndra, calling federal loans to the company an example of 'gross waste' by the Obama administration; move is countered by top Obama strategist David Axelrod, who criticizes Mitt Romney's tenure as the governor of Massachusetts during an appearance in the state.

byline.original: By ASHLEY PARKER and MICHAEL D. SHEAR
byline.contributor: Ashley Parker reported from Fremont, Calif., and Michael D. Shear from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney used Solyndra’s headquarters to emphasize the Obama administration’s failings, while an Obama aide took his message to Mr. Romney’s former workplace in Massachusetts.

headline.seo: Romney and Obama Campaigns Pick Provocative Venues
headline.main: Two Locations Chosen to Annoy the Other Side
headline.print_headline: Two Locations Chosen to Annoy the Other Side
